title: As fun as the preseason looks, it doesn't look as fun as if Riot started punishing inting and afking
body: I am genuinely really excited for the preseason as a lot of it looks like a blast. Specifically, Summoner's Rift terraforming to match the dragon that's spawning looks like SO MUCH fun. But to be totally honest, I think what would be even more fun is if Riot started discouraging people in any way from inting and afking. I love the idea of the extra bushes and rocks places, but I think I would love even more if 20% of games weren't ruined by someone actively trying to ruin them without any sort of repercussion. I also really like the breakfast nook they're adding to lanes, but not as much as I think I'd like it if I knew when I was logging in that I wasn't going to have to play three games in a row with the same adc running it down repeatedly while building ap. All of the item changes are also definitely moving the game in the right direction, but I think we could move the game even further in that direction if we eliminated all of the ranked games where 9/10 players have no effect because someone on one team decided to int or afk. Just some food for thought as we gear up for season 10!

I'm high MMR in normals and play with the same ~100 people basically all the time. There are 5 dudes who consistently either afk when things go bad, start inting, start shit talking, or leave their lane to steal their teammates' stuff around the map (steal jungle when they are ADC, etc.) I report these people every single game they are on either team and do something fucked up, which is damn near a daily basis. Despite this, none of them are ever punished and still show up in my games. Riot's automated ban system only cares if people say mean words in chat, they need to learn to detect people afk at tier 2 turret talking about how bad their team is all game.

I mean personally, I don't care what happens in normals. That's why people play normals, because it's supposed to be less stressful and less of a commitment than competitive. 

The core issue is how long League requires you to play a losing game. I can't personally think of any of video game that asks for a 45 min commitment to getting sht on. Who wants to get sht on for 45 minutes?

I don't blame the players for AFKing if the game is clearly a snowball.

I'll be completely honest, I've started AFKing games. If we're at the 20 min mark and it's a 5 tower advantage to their team with a 5v20 kill imbalance (you know the games I'm talking about), they've got all the dragons and they've snowballed so hard they're just fking with you for fun, I'm gonna go play something else and come back when it's time for the next game. Especially in this season with the new dragon layout, teams just snowball harder than ever. Personally, this season has kinda killed me love for the game.
